Summary I'm a Lead Architect for the upcoming family of Nvidia GPUs.  
 
My interests lie in studying parallel programs (e.g., CUDA), authoring tools to gain more visibility into how they perform on the GPU, and of course, to architect the GPUs to make these programs run even better. I interface with various teams within Nvidia to get everyone on agreement with upcoming plans. 
 
I was also a Senior Research Scientist at Nvidia Research, where I authored similar tools. I was also the author of a critical tracing tools still being used (now for over 5 years) for full-chip verification and performance analysis.  
 
I hold a Ph.D from University of Illinois in Computer Science, have published papers with over 100 citations (see Google Scholar), was the primary author a tool, Iperf, that has over a million downloads. 
 
I like tackling new problems with a long-term focus, learning from colleagues and mentoring colleagues. Of course, I love to code and debug along the way. 
 
Specialties: Area expertise: Graphics processors and associated APIs (CUDA, OpenGL and DirectX), real-time systems, computer networks.  
 
Language/OS skills where I've had 4+ years of working expertise. 
- Languages: CUDA/C/C++/Java/Perl/Python 
- OS: Windows and Linux. 
- Dev tools: Eclipse/Visual Studio. Summary I'm a Lead Architect for the upcoming family of Nvidia GPUs.
